result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA);
All applicable fees of supervision.
- No cash bail posted in this matter.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec.973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC dated February 13, 2015, Judge Timothy Witkowiak, JOC to state that defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for either the CIP or the WSAP programs.***
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with 343 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow rules of supervision any follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS with 343 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2.5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Jury back in box. At the hour of 3:37pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Counts 1 & 2, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF4935 that are attached to the complaint.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22 on 11/07/2014 at 8:30am.

Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury back in box at 9:13am.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officers Brian Adkins and Kim Lastrilla, Forensic Investigator Lee Vedbraaten, Milwaukee County Sheriff Detective Warren Spottek. 
Exhibit 1, 5, 6, 11 received.  Exhibit 8-10 received and published.  Sworn for the defense: Chidi O.  Jury out of box at 10:32am.  Sidebars places on the record.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Jury back in the box.  Stipulations placed on the record.   Jury out of box for lunch at 11:19am, instructed to return at 12:55pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.
Jury back in box at 1:06pm.  Sworn for the defense: Crystal W.   Exhibits 12, 13, 1A and 1B received.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:10pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Gunn and Klatkiewicz who were duly sworn for that purpose.

At 2:52pm jury back in box to view the video.  Jury out of box.

Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Christopher Calvin McGowan in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:20am.   Jury out of box for lunch, instructed to return at 1:25pm.  Jury back in box at 2:38pm, voir dire continued.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Geraldine B and Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Adkins.
Exhibit 1 published to the jury.  Exhibits 2-4, 7 received.  Exhibits 7 received and published.   At the hour of 4:52pm jury dismissed for the evening.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.
